title: Star Trek 6 The Undiscovered Country 1991 1080p Rifftrax 6ch 2ch
description:
Star.Trek.VI.The.Undiscovered.Country.1991.1080p.Rifftrax.6ch.2ch.mkv

DEFAULT AUDIO IS TRACK1 MOVIE PLUS RIFFTRAX
FOR MOVIE ONLY SOUND SWITCH TO TRACK2 FOR 5.1 OR TRACK3 FOR 2.0

THE VIDEO IS FROM THE BLU-RAY OF THE THEATRICAL VERSION
AUDIO1 INCLUDES DVD SPECIAL EDITION SCENES WITH RIFFS AT THE END

Star Trek VI: The Undiscovered Country (1991)
video: 1920x816 AVC
audio1 (default): movie plus Rifftrax AAC 2.0
audio2: just movie AAC 5.1
audio3: just movie AAC 2.0
subs1: Alien Only built in, on by default, not hard, soft switchable
subs2: Alien and English built in, off by default, not hard, soft switchable
video 1h49m58s, audio 1h50m22s
intro: 1s after the last riff comment
DVD Special Scenes: 1s after the intro
Rifftrax released 2007.02.09 2,441,998,439bytes

This is a remux with the Rifftrax commentary added as the default audio track. The Rifftrax audio track has been newly remastered to ensure the riff comments are just loud enough to be clear when the movie is loud and not too loud when the movie is quiet. Please leave any feedback regarding the Rifftrax audio remastering.

The original Rifftrax was done for the DVD Special Edition which is about 3m27s longer than the Theatrical Edition which was put on Blu-Ray and the video for this is based.

There are 4 extra scenes from the DVD not on the Blu-Ray:
      DVD Time Range / Blu-Ray Time
1) 0h38m54s-0h40m41s / 0h38m54s - Operation Retrieve presentation
2) 0h43m15s-0h44m36s / 0h41m28s - Torpedo storage discussion on the new Chancellor
3) 1h42m44s-1h42m47s / 1h39m33s - The assassin's blood being inspected
4) 1h42m51s-1h43m02s / 1h39m37s - The unmasking of the assassin

There were also some changes with little or no time changes:
1. Scott at the conference table with some of the Enterprise's blueprints
2. A close-up of Kirk for a short moment on the bridge
3. Visions of the plotters while Spock mind melds

The riffs from the 4 extra scenes are included after the intro that plays during the credits. This is audio only and is only on audio1: 2.0 Riff. The intro and the audio from the extra DVD scenes cause the total running time to be 24 seconds longer than the video. The screen will just be black for the last 24 seconds.

Big thanks to the posters of the 1080p/5.1 encodes of the movies, the subs and the chapters.
